His denial of Jesus three times before the cock crowed was due to three things: First, he wanted to get along with those who were asking him about himself and remain inside the house to follow what was going on. Second, God wanted to teach him a lesson in preparation for his role as a patron of the church so that he would perform that role without pride or feeling of importance. He was taught that due to his pride in acknowledging his master he fell into denying Him. Third, when God saw him feeling superior to the other disciples and confident of his own courage and determination not to deny the Lord, the Lord left him so that he would learn that without the heavenly care and providence he would not be able to fulfill his words and promises. He lost his moral courage in front of a slave girl and denied his master.
